text.p: SOLIDERE shares rose on Friday on the Beirut Secondary market continuing a rally begun on Monday.

A shares rose on the privately-operated BSM to $108.5 from Thursday's $106.875 and B shares rose to $111.375 from $108.5. It was the fifth day that B shares have risen this week compared to four days of gains for A shares.

Dealers have said momentum is building up because of the success of parliamentary elections and the victory of billionaire Prime Minister Rafik al-Hariri and many of his supporters in the polls has helped boost confidence in the Lebanese economy.
The first four rounds of the five-stage election were held on the past four Sundays amid widespread accusations of fraud but without serious violence. The Bekaa valley votes on Sunday.

On the Beirut Stock Exchange, there was trade in 8,000 Eternit shares at $1.9375 each. It was the first time that shares in the industrial piping manufacturer have been traded since July 15 when 250 Eternit shares were traded at $1.938.
There was no trade in any of the other three listed companies, Ciments Libanais, Ciments Blancs and Uniceramic.
Turnover on the BSM, which trades only SOLIDERE shares, rose to 8,403 shares from 5,306 on Thursday and value was $912,642.5 from $564,862.
The BLOM Stock Index rose 1.62 percent to 951.81 and the LISPI index rose 0.59 percent to 84.27. They cover both markets.
